int cimunit_mutex_trylock (cimunit_mutex_t *mutex)
 Attempt to lock a mutex.

Detailed Description

The cimunit_mutex component is used to prevent race conditions by limiting concurrent access to resources. It abstracts the operating system's native mutex capability.

Function Documentation

int cimunit_mutex_destroy ( cimunit_mutex_t *  mutex)

Destroy a mutex.

Clean-up all resources associated with the mutex

Parameters:
mutex- mutex to destroy

Definition at line 31 of file cimunit_mutex_pthread.c.

int cimunit_mutex_init ( cimunit_mutex_t *  mutex,
const cimunit_mutex_attr_t *  attr 
)

Create a new mutex.

Create a mutex that is initially unlocked.

Parameters:
mutex- pointer to mutex object
attr- mutex attributes. This hasn't been used to-date and may be removed. Use of it would require the C code creating the mutex to be platform specific, which violates the intention of abstracting this capability.

Definition at line 24 of file cimunit_mutex_pthread.c.

int cimunit_mutex_lock ( cimunit_mutex_t *  mutex)

Lock a mutex.

This method blocks if the mutex is already locked

Parameters:
mutex- mutex to lock

Definition at line 35 of file cimunit_mutex_pthread.c.

int cimunit_mutex_trylock ( cimunit_mutex_t *  mutex)

Attempt to lock a mutex.

This method doesn't blocks if the mutex is already locked

Parameters:
mutex- mutex to lock
Returns:
0 if the mutex was locked else non-zero
